entities.name: Samuel Benjamin Bankman-Fried
entities.context: Samuel Benjamin Bankman-Fried (born March 5, 1992), commonly known as SBF, is an American entrepreneur who was convicted of fraud and related crimes in November 2023.

entities.name: FTX
entities.context: Bankman-Fried founded the FTX cryptocurrency exchange and was celebrated as a 'poster boy' for crypto, with FTX having a global reach with more than 130 international affiliates.

entities.name: Alameda Research
entities.context: On November 11, 2022, FTX, Alameda Research, and more than 130 associated legal entities declared bankruptcy

entities.name: Barbara Fried
entities.context: His parents are Barbara Fried and Joseph Bankman, both professors at Stanford Law School.

entities.name: Joseph Bankman
entities.context: His parents are Barbara Fried and Joseph Bankman, both professors at Stanford Law School.

entities.name: Gabriel Bankman-Fried

attributes.relationship: younger brother of Samuel Benjamin Bankman-Fried

entities.context: Sam's younger brother, Gabriel (b. 1995), had been a legislative assistant and a Wall Street trader. He became director of the nonprofit Guarding Against Pandemics.

entities.name: Adrienne Fried Block

attributes.relationship: maternal grandmother of Samuel Benjamin Bankman-Fried

entities.context: His maternal grandmother, Adrienne Fried Block, was a noted musicologist.

entities.name: George Fried

attributes.relationship: maternal grandfather of Samuel Benjamin Bankman-Fried
attributes.occupation: administrator with the New York State Supreme Court probation department

entities.context: His maternal grandfather, George Fried, was an administrator with the New York State Supreme Court probation department.

entities.name: Linda P. Fried

attributes.occupation: dean of Columbia University Mailman School of Public Health

entities.context: His aunt Linda P. Fried was the dean of Columbia University Mailman School of Public Health.

attributes.statement: termed Bankman-Fried 'the Bernie Madoff of crypto'

entities.context: the financier Anthony Scaramucci termed Bankman-Fried 'the Bernie Madoff of crypto'.

entities.context: following fund injections from billionaire computer programmer Jaan Tallinn and investor Luke Ding

entities.context: He became director of the nonprofit Guarding Against Pandemics and its associated political action committee.

entities.context: After attending a cryptocurrency conference in Macau in late 2018, he moved to Hong Kong. In September 2021, Bankman-Fried and the entire senior staff of FTX moved from Hong Kong to the Bahamas.

entities.name: United States v. Bankman-Fried
entities.context: In the case of United States v. Bankman-Fried, he was convicted of all seven counts of fraud, conspiracy, and money laundering. On March 28, 2024, he was sentenced to 25 years in prison and ordered to forfeit $11 billion.

entities.name: Appeal Event

entities.name: New Trial Request Event

entities.name: Federal Appeals Court Hearing Event

attributes.argument: conviction should be overturned due to presumption of guilt
